shortdesc.ph: Updates channel media options after joining the channel.
Updates the channel media options after joining a channel.
Updates channel media options after joining the channel.
Updates channel media options after joining the channel.

p.codeblock: public abstract int UpdateChannelMediaOptionsEx(ChannelMediaOptions options, RtcConnection connection);

section.title: Return Values

ul.li:
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting.
-2: Invalid values. For example, using an invalid token or setting an invalid user role. You must provide valid parameters.
-7: The object is not initialized. You must initialize the object before calling this method.
-8: The internal state of the object is incorrect. This may happen if the user is not in a channel. Use the callback to determine whether the user is in a channel. If you receive ConnectionStateDisconnected(1) or ConnectionStateFailed(5), the user is not in a channel. You must call before using this method.

< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
-2: The value of a member is invalid. For example, an illegal token is used or an invalid user role is set. You need to provide valid parameters.
-7: The object is not initialized. You need to initialize the object before calling this method.
-8: The internal state of the object is incorrect. A possible reason is that the user is not in a channel. It is recommended to determine whether the user is in a channel through the callback. If you receive ConnectionStateDisconnected(1) or ConnectionStateFailed(5), it means the user is not in a channel. You need to call before calling this method.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li:
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
-2: Invalid member values. For example, using an invalid token or setting an invalid user role. You need to provide valid parameters.
-7: The object is not initialized. You must successfully initialize the object before calling this method.
-8: Internal state error of the object. This may be because the user is not in the channel. It is recommended to use the callback to determine whether the user is in the channel. If you receive CONNECTION_STATE_DISCONNECTED (1) or CONNECTION_STATE_FAILED (5), it means the user is not in the channel. You need to call before calling this method.
